body_html:
Tried that. Still the same error.

Another thing I did was installed the TF binary with GPU support. Tried importing in a different shell(fish).
Got this error:

body:
Tried that. Still the same error.

Another thing I did was installed the TF binary with GPU support. Tried importing in a different shell(fish).
Got this error:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/Users/ojas/.pyenv/versions/ve2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/__init__.py", line 23, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python import *
  File "/Users/ojas/.pyenv/versions/ve2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/__init__.py", line 48, in <module>
    from tensorflow.python import pywrap_tensorflow
  File "/Users/ojas/.pyenv/versions/ve2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 28, in <module>
    _pywrap_tensorflow = swig_import_helper()
  File "/Users/ojas/.pyenv/versions/ve2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/pywrap_tensorflow.py", line 24, in swig_import_helper
    _mod = imp.load_module('_pywrap_tensorflow', fp, pathname, description)
ImportError: dlopen(/Users/ojas/.pyenv/versions/ve2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so, 10): Library not loaded: @rpath/libcudart.7.5.dylib
  Referenced from: /Users/ojas/.pyenv/versions/ve2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so
  Reason: image not found
```
